circumstances: While descending to King Cove Airport in marginal weather conditions, the twin engine airplane (fog and rain) was too low and struck the slope of a mountain located southeast of King Cove. The aircraft was destroyed upon impact and all six occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
Control flight into terrain following improper in-flight decisions on part of the pilot-in-command. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Inadequate preflight preparation, 
- Inadequate supervision of flight crew, 
- Low ceiling, 
- Rain,
- Low altitude visual approach in mountainous terrain, 
- Crew not familiar with destination geography.
